thread.title: Asiana Airlines | net loss | 2Q | 1H
thread.title_full: Asiana Airlines | net loss | 2Q | 1H | Finance & Data content from ATWOnline

author: Jeremy Torr
title: Asiana Airlines | net loss | 2Q | 1H
text:
Asiana Airlines posted a second-quarter net loss of KRW85 .4 billion ($72.4 million), deepened from a net loss of KRW11.8 billion for the year-ago period.
The airline said the results were due to “passenger business in the second quarter [being] much affected by Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS), first confirmed in May. That caused a spike in the number of cancellations of trips by Chinese and Japanese tourists.”
The MERS outbreak is estimated to have brought an 80% drop in international tourist bookings to Korea, worth over $90 million in travel sales.
Asiana’s second-quarter revenue was down 8% to KRW1.3 trillion from KRW1.4 trillion, resulting in an operating loss of KRW 61.4 billion, reversed from an operating profit of KRW3 billion a year ago.
Passenger revenue also fell 7.7% from the corresponding period in 2014, while cargo revenue fell 13.5%. The airline attributed poor cargo sales mainly to a slump in European business.
In the first half, the South Korean carrier reported a net loss of KRW25.8 billion, narrowed from a 2014 first-half net loss of KRW 58.3 billion.
The airline recently committed to a 25-strong $2.83 billion A320neo order from Airbus, to be used to expand its domestic network.
